newsitem.title: POLAND: POLISH C.BANK OFFICIAL SEES STRONGER ZLOTY - PAPER.
newsitem.headline: POLISH C.BANK OFFICIAL SEES STRONGER ZLOTY - PAPER.

text.p: The Polish zloty should strengthen against its currency basket after its recent fall, caused by last month's outflow of speculative foreign capital, the head of the central bank's foreign operations department said.
"I belive that after a brief weakening, the zloty will strengthen," Krzysztof Majczuk told the Gazeta Wyborcza daily.
He said the National Bank of Poland (NBP) did not intervene while the zloty fell to record lows last month because it did not want foreign currency speculators to profit.
"We did not intervene because we wanted speculative foregin capital, which was selling zlotys, to buy dollars at less favourable rates," Majczuk was quoted as saying.
On Friday the zloty closed at 0.74 percent below its parity rate, up from record lows around minus 5.7 percent in mid-July.
The NBP monetary policy head Jerzy Stopyra also told the Rzeczpospolita daily on Saturday that zloty was no longer under downward pressure on the forex market.
"In the last days there were no speculative dollar purchases (on the forex market)," Stopyra said.
